alert.note: Alert for Bradley; Calhoun; Union (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 11:23AM CDT until April 12 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas... Black River At Pocahontas affecting Randolph County. Ouachita River At Thatcher L&D affecting Bradley, Union and Calhoun Counties. Black River At Black Rock affecting Jackson, Independence and Lawrence Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO LATE TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ouachita River At Thatcher L&D. * WHEN...From late tonight to late Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 79.0 feet, Property in low lying areas needs to be removed. Access roads to oil and gas rigs may be flooded. Levee gates should be closed before the river reaches 80 feet. There is minor flooding at this level. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 78.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight on Friday to a crest of 79.5 feet Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 79.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecast 1 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Crest Time Date Ouachita River Thatcher L&D 79.0 78.2 Thu 10 AM 79.2 79.5 79.5 79.5 7 AM 4/09 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
